title: Ticket #1133: MyType not reported in "condor_q -l" output.
description:
I have installed the 32 bit version of Condor 7.4.1, both on Linux and on Windows. Both installs are essentially personal pools, with a single machine running the CM, schedd, and startd.

I've successfully submitted jobs to the scheduler, and they run without incident. But if I run "condor_q -l <cluster.proc>", the MyType attribute is not printed out in the job's ClassAd. This happens consistently and on both platforms.
remarks:
2010-Jan-25 11:39:20 by matt:
This is because MyType and TargetType are special. They are also not available for constraints and policy, which is annoying, see #508.

2010-Jan-25 11:40:15 by matt:
I suspect this might be an issue that goes back to the beginning of time, e.g. v070000. Is this new to 7.4.1?

2010-Jan-25 13:03:35 by rfutrick:
Hi Matt,

No, this was not a problem in 7.0.0. I'm not sure about 7.2, but I'll be testing that soon as well.
creator: rfutrick
